newsitem.title: CONGO: Congo's 1996 real GDP growth at 6.8 pct - official.
newsitem.headline: Congo's 1996 real GDP growth at 6.8 pct - official.

text.p: Congo's National Monetary Committee issued the following updated indicators in the official ACI news agency:

The committee said growth in 1996 was powered largely by the petroleum industry, and to a lesser extent, the building and public works sector. Economic activity in other productive sectors was largely low-key.
The economy received a big boost with the inauguration last June of Elf-Aquitaine's giant Nkossa offshore oilwell, which is expected to increase Congo's oil production this year.
